name: SNOMED_CT
title: New Zealand integrated care module
description: SNOMED CT is the most comprehensive and precise clinical health terminology product in the world, owned and distributed around the world by The International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO).
copyright: © 2002-2016 International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO). All rights reserved. SNOMED CT®, was originally created by The College of American Pathologists. filter.description: Includes all concept ids that have a transitive is-a relationship with the code provided as the value.
Includes all concept ids that have a transitive is-a relationship with the code provided as the value, excluding the code itself.
Includes all concept ids that are active members of the reference set identified by the concept id provided as the value.
The result of the filter is the result of evaluating the given SNOMED CT Expression Constraint.
The result of the filter is the result of evaluating the given SNOMED CT Expression Constraint.
Includes all concept ids that have/do not have a parent concept.
filter.value: A boolean, to specifiy whether or not the property has a value.

filter.description: Includes all concept ids that have/do not have a child concept.
filter.value: A boolean, to specifiy whether or not the property has a value.

filter.description: The result of the filter is the Most Specific Greedy Ancestor of the given ValueSet URI, bounded by the rest of the concepts matching the filter.
filter.value: A ValueSet URI to compute the Most Specific Greedy Ancestors of.

property.description: Whether the code is active or not (defaults to false).
True if the description logic definition of the concept includes sufficient conditions (i.e., if the concept is not primitive).
The SNOMED CT concept id that is a direct parent of the concept.
The SNOMED CT concept id that is a direct child of the concept.
The SNOMED CT concept id of the module that the concept belongs to.
